page.title: 07RESIDENTIAL HOMES
page.content: The Royal Berkshire Court is a private Home, unlike Ladygrove, a Council Home, which is mentioned on Page 5. There are 60 rooms, 50 women and 10 men. There are 4 staff and there is a 3 year waiting list for admission. Mrs Scott, the Warden is in charge. Mrs Swanzy has a broken leg. She enjoys it at The Royal Berkshire Court. They have a big garden to share. They each have a room of their own and all the furniture is their own. Ladygrove, previously mentioned , is one stage lower than Berkshire Court: some people might go on from Ladygrove to The Royal Berkshire Court. They have lots of activities in the home, like bingo, whist and bridge. A doctor is on hand if a resident is ill. Most of the people who go to the R.B.C. do so because they like the company and meeting lots of their friends.
